topics.body: Do you know what the proper emergency treatment is for an open wound on a tarantula?
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/558367f06368722a06002135#post_558367f06368722a06002135
Spaghetti and meatballs
topics.author: 500b587e7f123b1f230014a9

topics.body:
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5583687e6368722c760020d6#post_5583687e6368722c760020d6
The correct answer is Super Glue.

You need to apply super glue to the wound and let it dry. That'll stop the bleeding.

topics.body:
"@Carcass Strife":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/558369236368722a060023c9#post_558369236368722a060023c9
I don't know, it's just something I came across in my tarantula research. Did you also know that tarantulas don't actually need to drink water unless in an emergency situation? They absorb all the moisture they need through their exoskeleton. So it's very prudent to keep the water dish filled in a tarantula's terrarium.
